org.dkpro.core.api.resources

Class ResourceObjectProviderBase<M>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dkpro.core.api.resources.ResourceObjectProviderBase<M>
  • Type Parameters:
    M - the kind of resource produced
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasResourceMetadata
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CasConfigurableProviderBase

    public abstract class ResourceObjectProviderBase<M>
extends Object
implements HasResourceMetadata
    Base class for resource providers that produce a resource from some URL depending on changing parameters such as language.

    A component using such a provider sets defaults and overrides. The defaults should be set to sensible values with which the component should be able to work out of the box. For example the LOCATION may be set to "classpath:/resources/${language}/model.ser.gz".

    The overrides should only be set if the user explicitly wants to override some settings.

    Finally, parameters that may change, e.g. depending on the CAS content should be returned from getProperties().

    The LOCATION may contain variables referring to any of the other settings, e.g. "${language}".

    It is possible a different default variant needs to be used depending on the language. This can be configured by placing a properties file in the classpath and setting its location using setDefaultVariantsLocation(String) or by using setDefaultVariants(Properties). The key in the properties is the language and the value is used a default variant.

      • SHARABLE

        public static final String SHARABLE
        If this property is set to true, resources loaded through this provider are remembered by the provider using a weak reference. If the same resource is requested by another instance of this provider class, the same resource is returned.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setDefaultVariantsLocation

        public void setDefaultVariantsLocation(String aLocation)
        Set the location in the classpath from where to load the language-dependent default variants properties file. The key in the properties is the language and the value is used a default variant.
        Parameters:
        aLocation - a location in the form "some/package/name/tool-default-variants.properties". This is always a classpath location. This location may not contain variables.

      • setDefaultVariants

        public void setDefaultVariants(Properties aDefaultVariants)
        Sets language-dependent default variants. The key in the properties is the language and the value is used a default variant.
        Parameters:
        aDefaultVariants - the default variant per language

        Set an object which can be used to try finding a Maven POM from which resource version information could be extracted.
        Parameters:
        aObject - a context object, usually the object creating the provider.

      • getModelVersionFromMavenPom

        protected String getModelVersionFromMavenPom(String aComponentGroupId,
                                             String aModelGroupId,
                                             String aModelArtifactId,
                                             Class<?> aClass)
                                      throws IOException
        Tries to get the version of the required model from the dependency management section of the Maven POM belonging to the context object.
        Returns:
        the version of the required model.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was a problem loading the POM file
        FileNotFoundException - if no POM could be found
        IllegalStateException - if more than one POM was found, if the version information could not be found in the POM, or if no context object was set.

      • getModelLocation

        protected String getModelLocation()
                           throws IOException
        For use in test cases.
        Returns:
        the location of the model.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the language-dependent default variants location is set but cannot be read.

      • configure

        public void configure()
               throws IOException
        Configure a resource using the current configuration. The resource can be fetched then using getResource().

        Call this method after all configurations have been made. A already configured resource will only be recreated if the URL from which the resource is generated has changed due to configuration changes.

        Throws:
        IOException - if the resource cannot be created.

      • getModelResolver

        protected org.apache.ivy.plugins.resolver.DependencyResolver getModelResolver()

      • getResource

        public M getResource()
        Get the currently configured resources. Before this can be used, configure() needs to be called once or whenever the configuration changes. Mind that sub-classes may provide alternative configuration methods that may need to be used instead of configure().
        Returns:
        the currently configured resources.
